How to Publish your HTML to a Webpage on Azure

1. Add the Azure storage exstention on Visual Studio Code

The first thing you want to do is head into Visual Studio Code and head to the exstention tab. In the exstention tab you will search the exstention market- place for Azure storage. You will install this as this what you will use to publish your webpage. Once it is installed, login to your azure student account. If you do not have a Azure student account you can create a free account and get 200$ worth of free credits. Then sign in.(Image of the correct azure storage)

2. Configuring your storage account to host a webpage

1. The first thing you will need to do is to head to your azure portal and login.

3.Go to static webpage configuration

The next thing you will do, is go to static webpage so you can configure, the webpage

Enable Static webpage and fill in index and error path

The next thing you will do is click on enable static webpage. Then you will fill in the index document path with index.html then you will fill in the error documen path with error404.html then click save then you are done.

How to depoly to the website

The next step and the final step is to head back to Visual Studio Code. Once you are there right click on the project you are working on, then find where it says "Deploy to Static Website via Azure Storage". Once you click that it will deploy your static webpage. Then you can click "Browse to website" to view your webpage.
